tgZlagblX6hVPBLE01pCAA.text: I ate at the Carolina's downtown for nearly 10 before I retired - at least once a week.  And traveled from the West Valley to get their food after that.  I was very pleased when they opened one in Peoria.  Their food is excellent -- best refried beans, which is my test of a good Mexican food place.

YmDBshjMWjoxjrbLWhJRvA.text: Pretty decent food, popular with the older community. Service is hit and miss. Not a fan of the salsa, very tomatoey not enough kick.

uAb894SgUHcHsxLiiQhJNg.text: Been a fan for years! Always good and cheap! Big portions too! #10 green with chicken is the best. Green tamales are excellent!

KK-QqsqcISzWuk_QgD0suQ.text: DIRTY ~~~DIRTY~~ DIRTY  called main ofc to tell em how dirty it was--they said it was a franchise - just using their name- never again

-2-zQcVpsZtzQCpUiSkwTA.text: This taco shop has to be one of my favorites. I can spend a five to six dollars and be too full. This is their third location and I think looks the best interior design wise. I think all of their items are excellent and very reasonably priced. No alcohol, no servers and nothing gourmet but is a great place.

_2i_olQvsFaDJKCMtD9MBA.text: Delicious food; terrible service. After no greeting, no smile, a 16 minute wait for a combo, no apology, no "thank you," and a very sloppy container delivered to me, I was done. The food, however, was so good that I had to bump up the rating a notch or two. Because of the food, I'll give it one more try, but the service needs to be better.

UD17pd3XJ0PCzBJ9Kq17eQ.text: Best Mexican food in town. Totally authentic my husband and I eat here at least 2x a week. Yes it gets very busy at lunch and dinner time but that's because the food is so amazing!! People give this place bad reviews for napkins being on the floor. With a crowd as big as they get during lunch and dinner would you really want them to slow down on getting out orders or pick up a few dropped napkins. And most 'authentic' Mexican food places do call your number over the speaker. (ie Carrumbas???) how else are you supposed to hear when they call your order with a crowd that large? If want Tex Mex (not authentic) go somewhere else. We love this place. Servers are nice food is excellent local and family owned traditional Mexican food. We love you Carolinas!!

WDRssDdzpNxevzhMJCDTDA.text: I have a huge party once a year. I usually have Carolina's make up the party platters. The mini chicken flautas are ok, need something more to spice them up. They stayed firm and not soggy. Unfortunately the mini beef chimichangas were so soggy, dark(like almost burnt) and very greasy. Not a nice presentation.  My order was ready and didn't have to wait half hour like last year. I would order the flautas again but will skip the chimi's.

XnwVV2wibng3p9JCDJcr5A.text: Service is great. Food is delicious , cheap and filling. What else can I say...

nXhZzvbJdOt-yyN5ZelYrA.text: This place sucks plain and simple I won't be coming back. I order a carne asada wet burrito. The salsa they use is from a can. The agua frescas suck too. There's a smell that won't go away maybe because they sell fresh chorizo.

VP5YNidRA50mimeK7DJA9g.text: I had a great first time experience with Carolina's Mexican Food. I needed to order catering for my office with a very short notice. Carolina's was able to fit my order in when they usually ask for a 24 hour notice and I gave them a 90 minute notice! When I arrived to pick up my platters the restaurant was BUSY!! The girl behind the counter greeted me promptly, chatted and joked with me while they were packing up my order ,then carried and placed the food in my car for me. I didn't have to lift a finger! I had ordered one chicken and one beef taco platter, a full tray of chicken enchiladas, and a full tray of rice and beans. This also included chips and salsa. Everything was delicious, everyone in the office enjoyed the food and went for seconds. I did not have any complaints and all my coworkers wanted to know where I ordered the food from... Thank you Carolina's for providing my office with great food under such a short notice, with friendly customer service. I will be back!

OtDbjnx0wY4MKebvzmUHyg.text: I've been meaning to review them since we first went there and now I'm glad I didn't. we've  been going there for about 7 months or so. First I fell in love w/ the shredded beef enchiladas and had them every time we went. But then they quit cooking the corn tortillas before they filled them,.. Yuk! So after a few of those I tried the red chile burrito... Again I loved it. Probably the last few months that has been my go to at least 2xs a week. But now (the last 3 or 4 xs) they have cut how much meat they put in it. And while I'm a fan of the sauce and the tortilla, Its just a large wet tortilla without the meat... Again Yuk! Last night was the last time for us. I wish I had taken a pic of it. The tortillas are huge , there was more than enough sauce and maybe 10 small pieces of meat. Really? That meat didn't fill 1/4 of the burrito !! I think we're done.

2yjZg2D3ZNWQDqiCSwlKLQ.text: If anyone thinks this place is authentic... I wonder what they consider Taco Bell to be? Heaven? I had the bland Chicken Burro which was very disappointing. Then I also had 2 Tamales with Rice and Beans. My friend had 2 Cheese Enchilada plate. When we opened them, we couldn't tell the difference. They were both swimming in the same canned sauce. The only way to tell the difference was finding the maize from a Tamale. As for the rice, I never knew Spanish Rice was supposed to be crunchy and undercooked.... Just over all a let down. AZ should open the border back up and get real food here. If you are a True foodie, don't bother with this place.

-g3-0yRfqFqPzNujVAkOeg.text: They have the worst customer service and organization.  Called ahead for order.  Arrived and paid for it said they would call me when ready, assuming few minutes.  Fifteen minutes later people coming in and ordering after I paid got there food.  When I could get someone's attention and asked about my order it was just sitting there.  No apologies or anything.  40 minutes even after calling ahead is bad.  This is not the first time but will be the last.....

7nV1GBi57z3qVGx2B11s3g.text: This is definetly in an old Fazoli's, I know because I help open it when it was built.  Food here is hit or miss, the green chile chicken burrito is blah. Dry and tasteless.  However, the hard shell chicken taco is very good. The cheese enchiladas are good but not great. I have had the chorizo and potato burrito and it is good,  but Ramiro's and Senor Taco do it better.   This was my second visit, first time i could not rate them because they did not have green salsa. This time they did and I give that 4 stars. But, they guy behind the counter acted like they are doing us all some kind of favor by selling it "Oh, your lucky today, we have green salsa". I guess they run out-proof was my first visit- but while it is good, I am not dying to put it on everything, so it is not that good. El Paisano in El Mirage is a carneceria that has the BOMB green salsa.   Why three stars-no carnitas or asada and the tortillas, well the are good but I don't crave them.  I may be a guera ( I am the gringa that speaks spanish and busts all the cabrons talking shit) but let me tell you, I grew up in a Mexican family in Hatch, NM/Las Cruces/El Paso area and have had some spectacular tortillas and these don't even come close.

uyYYYQowcr58brXYkT_GFw.text: Had heard people rave about this place so we finally tried it.  ABSOLUTELY THE WORSE MEXICAN FOOD I have ever eaten.   First the chips were cold and stale.  The sauce was overwhelming.  When our entres arrived, our enchiladas and tamales were swimming in that lukewarm sauce.  The beans were cold and the rice tasted funky.  Cashier surly!   Will never go back again.  I would have liked to have given negative stars for this restaurant.

O02cWRrwc2YdAw1FPsE4EQ.text: Five stars because I just had the best tacos (of this type) in my entire life at this place!  Yes, this is a fast food environment, yes they serve the food on paper plates, yes you bus your own table etc. etc. Who cares? Does everything have to be Durant's? The fact is, they do Mexican basics better than just about anyone.   I had shredded beef tacos and a single chicken soft taco. Both were the best in their class I have had in my life--including those I've had on trips to Mexico. The hard shell is done in a similar style to what you would find at Filiberto's The soft taco, well, is was a soft taco, but made with Carolina's famous tortillas. Both were a perfect combination of spice, meat, and cheese, with the usual lettuce thrown on as an after thought. The salsa you get out of the little pumps by the soda fountain was also very good.   Housed in an old Fazoli's or Pizza Hut or something, the atmosphere and appearance is similar to one of the newer Filiberto's, but the food sets it apart from the rest.   Oh, and it is cheap.   Love it!

tiEkVzmbUVYchgPOVQ6eBg.text: This restaurant is just as good as it's original location in South Phoenix.  With that said I would rate Carolina's as the best fast food Mexican eatery in the Phoenix metro.  You really can't get any better than this, you can try, but I doubt you will.  The location for the West Valley isn't bad right off of the 101 and Peoria Avenue.  Pretty centrally located considering the area.  The place is always clean, the workers are very friendly and add to a welcoming experience.  You really can't beat the prices for the quality that you're getting.  The place is always busy and I can totally see why.  Serving very tasty food at a low price.  What else can you ask for?

mOao5H_SjxxsS8ZwgE2dxw.text: I've been going to Carolinas for almost ten years starting with the location in downtown Phoenix. While I still hold that this location isn't quite the same, it is still very delicious. Green chili burrito, red beef tamale, and a machaca taco are all solid choices for lunch or dinner. The beans are amazing. Whatever you get, get rice and beans, promptly mix together and mouthgasm.

5hpixZXI22XkDN34c4DNqw.text: MmmMMmMMMm  Enough said!  This place ROCK!  Although sometimes around dinner time it can get pretty crowed, its well worth fighting Juan to get to your Enchiladas :)    The GM of Carolina's is a great guy too!  Yummy, inexpensive, quality, Mexican food!

0zVrAx_jXjzNptR1Z2jE9g.text: I really wish that they had chosen another location for Carolina's as my office shares the same parking lot and it is way too easy for me to walk across the parking lot and grab some of the best grub around.  Very hard to keep in marathon shape when eating there 4 times a week-I am weak with the discipline.  Their tortillas are the best in town hands down.  I had never tried a buttered or cheese tortilla until a co-worker ordered a few...very addicting.  They only have one salsa which is not fiery but has a kick, and their chicken burritos are just that, chicken and a tortilla.  No Chipotle style faire here. There is ample parking but seating can be a problem for those who don't work next door.  Hit 'em up if in the area!

B9OYJU1q_Y0y0Et4uhtyCA.text: I give this a two star because the service was good. The lady even let me sample the horchata. But the food was horrendous. I will never come here again  and only came here after getting a gift card. I ordered the mini chimichanga combo and my husband ordered a carne asada burrito. We decided to be thankful and eat our food but we really struggled finishing this. The chicken in my chimi tasted like canned chicken and tasted and looked it was boiled with no flavor. The beef had no flavor and the texture of it was chewed up beef. The cheese they grated on everything tasted as if it had sat out in the fridge too long and absorbed that fridge odor. The beans were runny with no flavor and I have used canned beans before and they've tasted better. The rice tasted moldy. I wonder if they're using old food or preparing too fast in advance and not keeping anything fresh. The horchata was powdery - I'm not sure what the exact texture should be for this but I've had many and none tasted like this. My husband said his burrito was very plain with no flavor. Im shocked because it was pretty busy when I came so there are some that definitely enjoy it! Not for us though. Nice service for sure though. Another thing - I didn't know you could go wrong with guac but they sure did unfortunately. The food needs to be refrigerated but fresh definitely isn't a concern. I usually don't mind if my food takes long if it's good and fresh but this food came out in 5 minutes and tasted worse. Sorry Carolina's.

a0PWiRxjCCfb77-AQHgw-Q.text: I Have been here several times and they mess up my orders everytime. This girl who took my order, repeated it to me and she still messed it up and then tried to charge me for what she forgot to include in my order. This happens way too much and it is very annoying.

hnm0jVZtedPT6xfySWaNBA.text: I have eaten at Carolina's so many times over the years and they were always excellent. Today though, I can't believe I didn't lose any teeth. I ordered the chicken mini chimi's that come with rice and beans. Y'all, there was a rock...I repeat, a rock in the second mini chimi I attempted to eat. It wasn't a bone, it wasn't burnt tortilla, it was a straight up rock. I have no clue how a rock gets in with shredded chicken ??? but it did. Since I obviously didn't know that there was a rock in my mini chimi I wasn't chewing on it gingerly. I wasn't expecting a foreign object to almost break my teeth out of my head. Needless to say, I was quite surprised and my molars hurt. I guess the human bite force is pretty strong because I broke the rock into two larger chunks and two small shards. I called the restaurant to inform them about the rock and at first either they didn't understand or they didn't think I was serious. After repeating myself and telling them that I'm lucky to still have teeth they said, "oh! Okay?". They didn't offer to do anything which I'm fine with. I wasn't looking for a free meal. If I had lost any teeth though, I would definitely have taken it further. Moral of the story...always chew your food as if it might have rocks in it. It will save your teeth and jaw from feeling like mine do right now.

photos.caption: Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States. Now that it&#39;s dry, you can see the different flecks and layers in the rock.
Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States. It&#39;s your garden variety rock that you see laying around outside in AZ every day.
Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States

9AsFexJzhRfvsLz5rWWiZQ.text: Tamales were good. Prices good. Fast service. I would get the tamales again but without the sauce as it took over the flavor

I-kKGOkUduSWH3ocUerZGg.text: I repent from coming here and waste my money on s h i t!!!  They should advertise as "the best white-washed piece of s h i t junk in town"  Carne asada tacos DO NOT have lettuce or cheddar cheese!!  Every day I get more convinced that white things will eat anything and call it great food.  So glad I'm not a gringo.  Ta'Carbon taqueria on 43rd Ave have such great tacos that this place doesn't compare to them, not even 1% close!!!  The only reason people come here is because it's close to their house, otherwise I cannot see a real reason why would anyone decide to be fooled a second time. Only fools!!!

FiObPuj6u3CK29hox05h9g.text: How Good Depends On What You Order.   I have been to Carolina's a few times.  The food at Carolona's is hit or miss and the quality really depends on what you order.  Once inside you walk up to the  order windows  and select your entree from a large menu.    As you wait for your entree to arrive you can hear staff calling out order numbers. Once our number was called we made our way up front grabbed our plates and asked for some salsa, that is  available in small paper cups filled by big stainless steel dispensers.  The hard-shell machaca burrito, rice and beans, horchata and tortillas were just okay. However, I found the cheese enchiladas to be mediocre (tortillas are hard, very little cheese).  The meal just wasn't very good.  It might be a while before I decide to re-visit Carolina's.

y2Ce6bbVjWt2pdDELUVyJA.text: Hair in tacos! Ordered 16 tacos and 2 family members found hair in theirs. Who knows if the rest of us ingested hair too. So gross. But then my niece calls and the manager Kalynn tells her she'll refund "the order". We drive over and I go in but now Kalynn will only refund 2 tacos $6 of an $80 order! Then she lies to my niece and says she told her over the phone only 2 tacos would be refunded. We wouldn't have driven over there after hours for that amount.  It's disgusting to find hair in your food 2x but then the poor customer service is just too much! Any other professional would have refunded all the money for food and the inconvenience of driving over there. But then again when your employees lie to the customer that tells me a lot about their customer service policy.

Hd7JvPHdgFVKgOtGOMjDHw.text: I catered Carolina's for my daughter's baby shower on Saturday. I ordered a tray of cheese enchiladas, a tray of machaca enchiladas, 1/2 a tray of rice, 1/2 a tray of beans and the 32 oz of guacamole. Everything was SOOOO good!!! We had 18 people there so it should have been plenty, but because several people stayed for quite a while after the shower ended and they kept eating, there was virtually nothing left! It made the clean up a breeze, but no leftovers for Sunday.  A wedding planner friend of my daughter's recommended Carolina's and I'm so glad she did!!! We have found our new favorite Mexican restaurant!!!

_Grv0W4I3oPIJ2xxgKKRRw.text: This place sucks I ordered a chorizo, potato and egg burrito and  it was one o'clock and they would not serve it because they  don't serve eggs after 11, I talked to the manager and said it is just a damned egg scrambled with chorizo, he said sorry we just don't serve eggs, will not be back. VIVA TRUMP And I am Mejicano!

8m5gm30ujGSFC26CcYhWrA.text: Awful service today- maybe the person training the staff should pay attention to who they are training.

4aCsF_74OGCgEod98rD76Q.text: The food here is soooo good! One of my absolute favorite places to eat. Prices are great. Be careful and check your food though. Starting about a year ago they mess up our order ALL the time. I would stop eating here because if the staff,  if the food wasn't so fantastic. Again food is GREAT staff is incompetent.

old-aMoZcoPWhH-o16B1gg.text: So good. The butter tortillas and bean burritos are my favorite. It's my favorite fast Mexican food in town.

YDfM0iEUSlVc4Q7NWbtnWw.text: Always like coming here. I really like their green burritos. Lots of nice chunks of pork. Their tortillas are some of the best I have had. They could do some up grade to the inside of the store. Not dirty just getting very worn. One drink machine not operating and no ice. This was at dinner time and the store had many customers waiting in line to order. Maybe why they ran out of ice. Every time I come here they are very nice and helpful.

OWJxagMMxiCREg6FCHc2TQ.text: Love Carolinas!  Been to the one on Cactus a handful of times and have been incredibly impressed with their beef tacos.  Have been to this one a handful of times and have had pretty good meals.  While not as good as the Cactus location (Still haven't been to the OG one downtown), their beef tacos were still good.  I was telling my wife how good they were and decided to come down here and show her what was up!    We placed our order for a combo #9, 4 shredded beef tacos, and a beef flauta for my son.  Total came out to $18.47.  Swiped my card, signed the receipt, got our salsas, waters etc and sat down.  A few minutes later, the food was ready.  My wife thought the beef tacos were just ok (she prefers other places like Lolitas, Fredericos etc).  Mine were as good as the Peoria location can be (still not as good as Cactus) .  My son ate a little bit of the beef flauta.  Meal completed, left, and everything was good.  Everything sounds great so far, right?  Well, it was....until I looked at my bank statement.  My bank statement showed a pending transaction from Carolinas for $23.47.  I thought it might have been an error, and it was pending for a good 4 days.  Know what though?  It cleared my account!  Someone added on $5.00 to my bill!  That is small enough for a lot of people not to notice, but that is also bullshit and will not fly with me.  I called my bank and they immediately refunded the money into my account.  They told me that if the merchant disputed it, I may see a charge back to my account (Which is what should have happened in the first place...I should have been charged $18.47 for the food I ordered!).    Anyways....I will be leery to come back here.  Ill take the drive to the Cactus location instead.  If there is a slim chance I do come back here to the Peoria one, I will most definitely be paying in CASH!  Watch your receipts at this place if you pay with your card!

JVZpEFkcKt74WiaH2eQdLw.text: Nasty doesn't begin to describe the food.  For a few bucks more, you can go to a real sit down Mexican restaurant.  I would rather go to any 'bertos than Carolina's again.  I literally got sick minutes after leaving.  Place was crowded, and noisy.  Tables were unbussed. Restroom looked like a truck stop.

xOq0UI6ODVlGQaZPnBITkw.text: A plaque on the wall recommended the red chili burrito, so I got the red chili burrito combo plate.  $7 later, my teeth sank into a surprisingly delicious burrito.  I thought the two extra dollars for shredded lettuce with a dab of beans and a dab of rice was a little high, but next time I got another one.  The three way burrito combo has both red and green chili.  Because of the taste, I'm giving them all five stars.   There's a large selection of soft drinks, including different flavors of  horchata.  The apple chimis and chocolate chimis are rich, hot and tasty.      I have been given to believe that if the tortillas were cooked slightly longer, the burritos wouldn't disintegrate.  Every single burrito falls apart before you can finish it, so be sure to grab a fork or, even better, a spoon, so you can spoon up the sauce when you rescue the burrito bits that fall  into your food box.   And thank you, Carolina's, for the individually wrapped forks, spoons and knives, because I like to know my cutlery is clean!

Zje_yob8bxs8kSw0htbyqg.text: The food here is good. Nothing amazing and the portions on things like the Chorizo burrito can leave you wondering if there is a tasty meat shortage you are unaware of...But the tortillas are damn good. The Enchiladas are my usual go to here and the salsa is pretty good.   All n' all I am glad it's in the neighborhood but it's not one of those amazing spots you must try. Plus them being closed on Sundays often makes them a miss for me overall.

M4lJE1rjh7dzF-CmO_4Uzg.text: This is always our family original place to come and eat ever since we were kids no matter which location you go to it's delicious and great, the people are friendly in the service is fast

photos.caption: Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States. If this answers your question , kids like this place its delicious and the prices are always Fair, very family-like and warming

6u2pX9LksZE8EiZxq2cJ5A.text: I have been a huge fan of Carolinas for years. They have revamped the menu and no longer have the authentic corn taco shells I loved. They have been replaced with store bought hard small shells. Basically they are like Taco Bell with much higher prices!!! Goodbye my old faithful place no longer my cup of tea. Very disappointed. I think this will sink your business

oT_Z0JBa0286ajNToohagw.text: Good food. Piss poor service. Good aweful takeout.  If you want a place to come in, get good food and sit and eat for a few, then this is fantastic. It's a great place to get something you crave and it'll hit the spot.   Don't ever order an anything to go, and not check your food. The people putting things together couldn't care less what's been ordered. Every takeout order is wrong, every time.  Nothing worse than driving to get food you crave, seeing it looks f*ing delicious, and then finding the one damn thing you don't want in your burrito.   Who the fuck puts tomatoes in everything... and why?  They're mushy and cold. They don't belong in my kick ass taco or burrito. Especially when I said "Don't Put Tomatoes In".  That said, they're good.  Don't knock it till' you try it.

ryX8l1NClmxPviV3gbTyLw.text: Pretty decent food. Doesn't quite compare to the original location but it's alright. Employees aren't too friendly they try rushing you to get to the next customer which then makes none of the customers feel appreciated. It's extremely loud in there no matter what time I go which makes it difficult to go there as a family

6VeQL-RzDeIQCY99Tri8Sg.text: First off the food is not that great. The staff working there is what really sets them to the lowest you can be. At work we often do a group order for lunch or dinner here and tonight they messed up giving us the incorrect item. I called to explain this as I couldn't eat what was given to me. The girl proceeded to tell me I have to bring it back or they won't do anything for me. They close in 10 minutes and I'm at work. I don't have time to drive there within 10 minutes let alone leave work again. She then proceeds to tell me that I got what was on the order and she's not going to do anything for me, in a rude, snobby attitude. I'm pretty mad at this point because what I got was not what I ordered. I ask for a Manager and I'm told there isn't one available. The girls name was Cavina Munoz that I spoke to. I will be down there tomorrow with the day old food that wasn't eaten. Hopefully the Management is better then the employees. Don't go here if you expect good service.

nB82Rgq2uXSX4-baJy9zog.text: Great homemade tortillas but meat was bland. Needed to use outside sauces and salsa to flavor, but maybe that's deliberate. Floor needed to be swept a little but appeared very clean otherwise. Very casual/simple dining, almost like fast food. Not a sit-down and be served by a waiter place; you stand in line and your food is handed to you on a plastic tray. Other reviews I've read seemed to have been expecting a traditional sit-down restaurant and that's just not what this place is. It's very laid back but the food is real good.

qEILjnZDBnt2HLc5llpG4w.text: After 4-5 visits since opening May 5th, I'm having trouble wanting to come back.  There are excessive delays in getting your food and a cluster of people standing at the side of the restaurant waiting for their orders too.  It's as if the location size (especially kitchen) can't handle the restaurant volume.  I've figured out that this place is more expensive than I thought because you simply can't fill up on just one item.  It's nice that the burrito is only $3.25 or so, but it's not enough for a hungry adult - add your tostada, chips/salsa, taco, soda pop, etc. and you're easily approaching $10.

iOhPZADbWRPiKU-KwwGvvA.text: Carolina's is amazing! Best Mexican food in Arizona! My wife and I come here at least once a week and the food is always delicious.  Sometimes they get crazy busy and it takes a while to get your food but that's because everybody knows the food is worth the wait! If you haven't gone here GO NOW! Your missing out

l8l3_SBLqcuPVfjEKwIGdw.text: Awesome food just as the one on cave creek,  can't beat the prices...  excited to find this location closer by..

z0byKLJAmSnExD37_AMdfg.text: Went here the other day with the family, I had heard their food is great. I have got to quit listening to these folks!!! This place blows!! The food is very bland the chili sauce is more than mild. The tacos which I had were cold and tasteless, the enchilada sauce was more like mole sauce?? did not expect that. Beans were okay but that was about it oh I almost forgot the chorizo was pretty good other than that the folks who give this high marks obviously have never had real Mexican food.

31sCIjLYU51hHiBmuxCheQ.text: Lost my order got attitude major when asked after wait 30 minutes lol just for two burritos way to ruin my lunch thx.

7xnmI0kgGnFK9lxj-pOdGg.text: My wife and I absolutely love this place. We sometimes eat there 3 times a week. We always love the food and the staff is great. They know our order as soon as they see us and start ringing us up. I would highly recommend this place.

CP43Oy0q_OikyZq-AAlXFQ.text: Carolina's West is as every bit as good as the original Carolina's! Including the price for the amount of food you get, and you can actually find a parking spot at this location...  I was pleasantly surprised to discover that they had a west side location, especially after trying the original spot. I questioned myself if the food was really that good for how far I'd have to drive. The answer was a resounding YES, and I almost flipped a table over when I discovered Carolina's accommodated the west side! Yay!

_TLwqYTQeB3R_IHqnPusSw.text: I LOVE this place!!! The food is excellent and the workers are so nice. I always get the same thing, the Oaxaca burrito which is amazing and a taco which is also really good, hence why I get the same thing every time lol. I've also tried the red & green chili which are really good too. I have nothing bad to say about this place just go and try it NOW!

K-yUFfalpoZYrJvPCoEU2w.text: Are you kidding?! My first visit to Carolina's was divine! I live most of the year in Seattle dreaming about great Mexican food... This trip, I found what I was looking for at Carolinas. I'd read about the restaurants in several magazines and finally made it to the west location.   My family and I sampled several dishes. The highlight being the enchilada sauce and tamales (red and green). I also enjoyed the taco and refried beans. All of the dishes satisfied my craving for authentic mexican food.  Carolina's has rocketed to the top of my Arizona "must do" list. I will visit often!

iyaBmMAzuV_RjCMT3XIGfQ.text: Love their prices & casual atmosphere. Great value & good food !

8dgsqIeKqsNkVUHsSfT78g.text: It's obvious that everyone that walks in the door here loves it. This is one of three Carolina's in the Phoenix metro.  I've wanting to try the original Carolina's near downtown but did not want to drive all the way down to "da ghetto" all "gangsta like" to eat some fast Mexican food.  I have been to both North and West locations and found them to be very good and consistent.    After standing in line to order like at a "taco stand" I sat down and noticed all the dishes coming out of the kitchen, and I started to almost drool.  Then my number was called and the funny urge to yell BINGO, but rather went up to the counter to get my piping hot Machaca Burrito with Papas and a side of chips and spicy salsa (served in styro-foam, ARGUE!!). While the salsa heat was almost too much for my taste buds, it was simply delicious and even took some home.   Holy cow, this was amazing for the price.  As so many others have mentioned their tortillas are simply delish!! The beans were a good consistency, not too runny, not to dry and the rice had a great flavor.  Again the food is a great value for the price.  In summary, despite that fact this place is NOT eco-friendly by using stryo-foam it is more over a place that is convenient off the 101 and Peoria if you're in the area looking for good, fast Mexican food. This is not necessarily a destination place to plan for but rather a place of convenience with tasty food.

oN1d0GBc3dxjoYcTz1Q-bA.text: I've definitely had better.  The food was good, but nothing I'd go back for.  I enjoyed the food at the little hole-in-the-wall across the street (Taqueria Los Angeles)  far more.  There was no comparison.    I ordered a couple machaca soft tacos and a chimichanga.  They were busy, but not overwhelmed.  It took 25 minutes to get my food.  People were getting a bit testy and a couple made a scene about the slow service.   I think the tortillas would have been good, but the tacos were so wet, I couldn't pick them up without them falling apart.  The machaca was bland until I doused them with salsa... that I had to ask for.     The chimichanga was good... loaded with the machaca beef.  It was still a bit bland though, but salsa helped.  I don't know if I'll go back.

59An30-OzutihuJHSEZ0xA.text: We love Carolina's!  Make sure you order the chips and salsa--they cost extra but are worth it!  The salsa is great, the food is affordable, and I recommend the Carne Asada.

nT3Mj3-iDINZUo55C5oQcg.text: Seriously, what more do you need to say about Carolina's than fresh flour tortillas.  If you get nothing else from Carolina's get a dozen tortillas to take home and feast on for days.  You'll regret it if you don't.  The rest of the food is pretty standard Mexican eatery fare.

oHBR3rDXzvF0ob5Us57rrQ.text: Love this place and couldn't wait for it to open. It was previously a Fazzoli location and the decor didn't change when Carolina's moved in. The menu is awesome. The menu got better. No matter what you order with menu numbers or ala carte, your food comes hot and delicious.  No speedy drive thru, their lobby is so busy  they closed it, to focus on customers face to face It's family owned and a freat place to fill up.

F7EyFM-Ut6Ab7Tu-S_55EQ.text: I don't get the obsession with this place. The tortillas are fresh but other than that everything is literally dripping in grease but not much flavor. Service is also slow considering it is set up as fast food. Plus any place that closes on Sunday gets an automatic loss of a star from me.

6Mp4TPGWkLWpPFaP6kEwyQ.text: best Mexican place in Peoria for sure! sucks they close in Sunday's! but so happy everyone there is super sweet & the burritos are the best hang over cure

lTE5b2CnQXzLLjCBITGEjA.text: When I was a kid, we stopped here regularly at the South Pheonix location for only two things: the tortillas and the beans. And this was always to go go so we could ready other things with it at home. This was also partly because it was considered a shady part of town. It wasn't until I was a teenager that we actually stayed to try other things.  I don't live in Phoenix anymore, but I visit regularly to see my family. Since they live in the west part of the valley, we go to this location now instead. It's in a much better part of town. Every time I come, I have to stop at Carolina's, and I have to get 2-3 burritos. It's either chorizo, red chili, or a bean burrito. Then I have to get tortillas & butter too. This is a solid breakfast burrito spot.

JBs8g-j9mUpKZOM9UVurmA.text: Great food and great service if you want good Mexican food I recommend you try this place!

Y45Yn_vs1KWWn9-vIal6Aw.text: Extremely disappointed. Haven't been here in a long time and was surprised at how crappy the customer service was, how over priced the food was, and how horrible the food tasted. Our chips were over cooked, the beans were soo runny they fell off my spoon, and if your meal comes with sour cream and guacamole don't expect more than a kid size spoons worth.  For what we paid, I could've gone to an actual restaurant and received better customer service and food!

5CWKW0NLzsXgvUXGc31TMA.text: Only thing good at this place is the tortillas. Food was bland and wait time is ridiculous to get our order

ik_SY9VSneKciG-r2HNWBQ.text: Ordered a cheese enchilada combo and a beef taco to go.  The shredded cheese inside the enchiladas was not melted at all.  Did they forget to cook it?   The beef taco was good, but very small for $3. Over the past several years Carolina's prices have increased and the quality and value have decreased.

lZNmlkXJTbc4yGo-K2OIXA.text: If you are looking for good tamales, this is NOT the place to get them. I ordered 6 Red, and ended up with 6 maza Tamales with a little brown stuff in the center.  Not a hint of Red to be seen anywhere, and I'm pretty sure that Brown stuff was not one of the options.  VERY disappointed!

SfxykdAIQP4jLZ-WF4tNpA.text: One of my favorite places to get a burrito! So delicious. Wish you guys had Jamaica though.

fhUsmw3Aw8ImAWr_InSvAQ.text: Decided to come down here for lunch one day.  It literally shares a parking lot to my office.    The place was really retro, it was kinda dirty, and the service was a little slow.  I had to wait like 21 minutes and 12 seconds for my food to be ready, and all I ordered was a pair of chicken soft tacos.  The food was okay at best, I got more lettuce than chicken, and the salsa was not hot at all.  It didn't have no kick or anything to it.  The cashier Samantha was very friendly and polite.   The place uses styrofoam boxes and stuff even when dining in, which I found not very unfriendly for the environment, and I personally think the price is a little high.  Overall a good experience, nothing really good or bad about this place.  I might come back someday, maybe.

WpjD-NMC2fvj7AbM_G1w2Q.text: Great place. First time here food was awesome. Ashley at the front was friendly and had a smile the whole time. Will definitely come back.

ZnoO9h6Wp_xXZ5g0sMN-PQ.text: Well it's the Carolinas here in Peoria off of 91st Avenue and Peoria sucks the food tastes like ass the original Caroline is the hole in the wall in Phoenix where Mama work was a bomb they should shut down the Carolinas in Peoria at 91st Avenue and Peoria and reopen Fazoli's because that place was actually good thank you O'Grady

_5yxZgAqX-z8uj2ClKicSg.text: Before there was Yelp, there was Carolina's Mexican Restaurant.   With it's cult following before social media,  it was already destined for greatness!  VERY reasonably priced and simply amazing Mexican food.  Will we back? Just try and keep me away!

zQup7Bwf2oDWb3RNyiewsQ.text: Buttered tortillas are amazing but everything else here is average at best. Got Red Beef Tamales and it was 95% masa. Burritos are ok but breakfast burritos are much smaller than most burritos around town.

-1AI308q0qIXhVCoCKVSqw.text: What a debacle. I asked for the mini chimis combo, 2 beef/1 chicken, no garnish, no guac. My friend asked for the same thing, but 2 chicken/1 beef. When we got our food, I cut into the chimis to see which was which. They were all chicken. My friend cut into his. All chicken. I brought one plate back up and said these are all chicken, just give us 3 beef. The guy took the plate and asks the cooks for 3 beef. Waited awhile and went back up to get it. There was garnish on top and no rice & beans! I told them and they looked at me like I was nuts. There was rice & beans initially, but the guy took it back! After all the back & forth, I finally got the rest of the order. It looked like some other customers had problems with their orders too. Not a good night for Carolina's. I'd give it 1 star, but the food was good in the end.

yg2AxLo76OCs-QcKWx9tNw.text: I've seen the light! :). The last review I wrote for the same restraunt in another location was not flattering to say the least. I have seen the upside of this location. this new spot is cleaner and I feel like I can walk in the neighborhood and not get blasted. Good food for cheap eats. I like it! I can still say after 7 years they have the best beef tacos I've ever had. There's only one spot in Phoenix giving them a run for their money but out of respect for the restaurant I won't name drop on their review. My only complaint is sometimes they're a bit greasy but totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States

n3u1YR8Yw8UF4QICWpD-kg.text: I have been going to Carolina's for awhile now and it continues to be one of my favorite Mexican places. I have them on speed dial! The quality of their food is pretty excellent. They have a great menu as well. Lots of good stuff on the menu and everything is great! They are generous with their serving sizes and I am always full after one of the combo plates.  This place can get busy during lunch time hours but don't let that be intimidating or deter you from coming. They are really quick with getting food out and you can sit down to eat or take it to go in no time at all.  There is a ton of parking in the shopping center. They have an entrance on either side of the building.  I would highly recommend this place to everyone if they are craving some good Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States. Beef chimichangas.
Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States. Cheese quesadilla.

3BXnjhlvH356Fnucd8ke7g.text: Love this place!!! The prices are good and the fresh tortillas omg amazing. The most yummy beans too!

qIt5xKVYj6v7xVzofSfJYw.text: The prices have become outrageous.  6.35 for a dozen tortillas? They are good but ......

prKag5EMLZ0Xk2Vq9YnWbg.text: Eh... I got a 2 chicken enchiladas. It was 8+ $$ I didn't get a drink with that. The rice and beans were quiet small. The beans are runny. There was barely any salt in the food.  Sorry filebertos gotcha by 3 1/2 stars... Compared to this for me

JnerxVLmvB2cz3vwWGj63w.text: Chile verde and potatoes burrito was excellent, can't wait until I am back in the valley to have another.

JJRdOZA8cMb6Be720R1aGQ.text: If you are starving Carolina's may save your life. Thats about all. I ordered a Taco (shreaded beef) Cheeze enchilada, and a Tamale with rice and beans. The Taco was flavorless in spite of being very greasy, the enchalada was saved from tasteless by a very mild sauce, which also covered the Tamale. Same problem, very little flavor. The rice was gummy and you guessed it  Tasteless. The "hot sauce" was so watered down it tasted bland also. Have then been sued by some 80 year old from Ohio? The Only redeeming item was the refried beans, they actually tasted like Pinto beans with just enough flavoring to be good. Oh, the counter crew didn't give me the Taco I ordered, until I pointed out that it was missing from my Styrofoam box. Not a good day at Carolina's, probably one of many. I just can't recomend this place. Maybe if they just make tortillas they would be Ok.

TmcbaJc85vSSyaAidbYLGA.text: SO good! Great prices, great portions - my only complaint is that I wish they had better salsa. The chocolate chimis are amazing.

Y8OUrvBdUmI_S6Ii4htutQ.text: Dicey to review a mexican food stop in Phoenix.  It's like trying to determine the best painting by Andy Warhol - subjective all the way and chances are you will find plenty of people who think his work is crap.  Authentic?  who the hell knows?    For me, I found a menu item I love and can eat it all day long here.  Have tried to recreate the taste at other establishments and haven't for twice the price or more.    So, Carolina's serves a purpose for me.  An infrequent indulgence of my favorite burrito and consistently prepared.  Peace

VHGBe9MqYSgKD-zikGdP7A.text: Love all of the food here. The green corn tamales and green chili with beef are my favorite. Gotta try the salsa.

Y8tlp-4dcwSTgaVRq_1eFA.text: The lines alone should show you how amazing the food is at this restaurant! My family loves to eat here. The food comes out and is served in a styrofoam containers which is a let down but do not let that fool you, because the taste is spicy! They have amazing different salsas to taste as well. Do not pass up on desert either, they have the best!

U9wDICEpY201osBMgSgrAQ.text: I am a Mexican American and growing up all my mother cooked was traditional mexican food. It is rare that I will go out to eat at a Mexican restaurant and enjoy my meal. I have tried enchiladas, beef crunchy tacos, red tamales and the beef green chile with their amazing tortillas. Will definitely go back there.

rL44dBAkyvYn_6AeYQQn3Q.text: Best food ever. Loved the way they cook their food and how it melts in your mouth. Truly amazing place to eat. Clean and friendly... 5 stars all the way around...

photos.caption: Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States. So good I almost liked the container :0)

vIn_QenJI5idgSZOkeO_mw.text: Great food. HORRIBLE service girls at register  are rude, not professional have tons of attitude  constantly on their phones texting.....cut keep up with who order what.....I would don't use this place to cater any of my business parties or to stop in to eat.  Customer service should always matter

u_i-ILL47E4GNhQGZl97_Q.text: 3 way burrito ($3.25).. not only is the name a whole lot of fun but it tastes awesome! Red chile, green chile and beans wrapped in one of their killer tortillas.. smooth, tender, creamy and delicious. Make it a foot long ($.90)and now were talking! Pair it up with their salsa and you're in for some great Mexican goodness!  I mentioned the tortillas but I REALLY need to mention them again, they are fucking kick ass! Stretchy while tender with a slightly smokey char taste, this is about as perfect as a tortilla can get. Because they were so messed up with our order the manager gave us a free dozen.. they were just made too, hot and steamy in the plastic bag. I couldn't wait and ate one immediately.. my gawd, great Mexican experience.   I love you Carolina, will you marry me?

HwNoPblDhJk77le58xmF3g.text: One of THE BEST mexican joints I've ever had the pleasure of visiting. It was a busy lunch hour, but even with a ten minute drive we got in and out in good time. The food was excellent, and of course we took home made tortillas for our place.  Will def be back, and be bringing family as well

8joOd-SO8RokSP-5u7ynQA.text: Ahh.. That was gross. I feel like vomiting just remembering our experience there. I don't eat beef so we ordered flautas, burritos and tacos (all chicken). It was the same mixture of gross, bland chicken in all three items. The chicken looks horrible, has a disgusting texture and lacks in flavor. Also, the place is filthy like another reviewer mentioned. I didn't dare to go the bathroom but there was paper on the floor under every single table.The health department needs to shut them down!

6S6rxSEVwSBum_TOfwoPrg.text: The best, most authentic Mexican food!  I have eaten at most of the Mexican places in the valley during my life and while there are equals and many wanna be's, Carolina's is one of the greats!! I started at their original location many years ago, went to the east side location when I moved that way, and now I try to get to the west side location 2-3 times a month. As has been said before, the tortillas are fantastic!! The tacos are large, fresh and full of flavor. I get the beef or machaca (you have to ask) tacos and a red chili burrito when I visit. The red chili has the tart, earthy, smokey flavor that authentic chili sauce should have. The re-fried beans are fresh and made with lard the way they should be. Don't let the word lard scare you!! Real re-fried beans are made with it and that is what gives them the creaminess and flavor that all fried beans should have!  The staff has always been friendly, and while I cannot speak for others, there are tons of people working behind the counters and I have never had anything but quick, friendly service. The ordering line ALWAYS stretches to the door (or out the door) and the 'to go' area is ALWAYS packed. That says something about the place's quality.

FKf1B2SQwAfpGO3h6-dy6g.text: The food is always awesome.  Best in the area.     The people behind the counter need to pull their heads out of their asses.  Don't be rude to me if I ask for an extra bag to carry my food.  I'd be happy to let the food drop to the floor for you to clean up.

XYAAjlER8i-AG-FP8Hxa8Q.text: We checked out this hole in the wall after staying at a nearby resort just because of yelpers. It was good. We weren't overly impressed and never made our way back but it is worth checking out if you're in the area and want a fast food feel but more authentic mexican.

6WNZEyhHkfitiXal2ZxVxg.text: Service wasnt friendly.  Food not that great.  They dont have carne asada. No street tacos.   They are catering to the more American palate.

EdFtLSK3_C4h-xScBQfFWQ.text: Not enough stars to click on.  I dine at the one in Peoria and it' s always clean, staff is friendly and the food is amazing.  Portions are generous.  Highly recommend !

jSI37R_FmYUg0F9N8hTL8A.text: Oh Carolina's, how are you so good? I'm hooked on the chicken, sometimes mix it up with enchiladas. The tortillas are by far my favorite. You MUST get a buttered tortilla, little slice of heaven. I love that they have horchata as a fountain drink and the hot sauce is just the right amount of spicy. It's always crowded, which is fun. Best Mexican on the west side!

sm3zMOmW80ogO3gCx106ow.text: Such good food! Always stop there once or twice when I'm in Phoenix.

eNSl-0EAbI6wDQh9I_dwhA.text: Tried this based on a review by Seftel in the Republic. Really good down-home Mexican food! Hubs had a red Chile burrito, I had green Chile Machaca. Flavor was excellent, meat very lean, tortilla perfect. Green corn tamales also very tasty.

JftNj7dgt8-ec2GRqeY8LQ.text: I have grow up in Arizona with Mexican food and this place is THE BOMB!!  I am very picky when it comes to my Mexican food (No one can compare to my Nana, God rest her soul)  I am addicted to their hot sauce.  You have to take some tortillas home with you or you will have to drive back just for them.   It is like fast food there, food served in Styrofoam and plastic silverware so if you can get over that you will not be disappointed.

cc4tQU1uxgXK5fIbRnc-9w.text: Very casual and everything is ridiculously cheap and flavorful. Best fast food Mexican bar none. Closed Sundays!

-5Yf6s7255QRDi8oLAYEog.text: Place lacks quality control.  Ordered the machaca combo, and it was completely void of flavor.  Please add salt...even the salsa was bland.  Come on, get it together.

c31WI37q7-rItD37s5T6AA.text: I love to come here in the morning and have tacos and get fresh made tortillas.  But service us starting to go down. There are some employees who avoid you when you ask for things and try to shove you off to ask somebody else. There are some still good employees but very few.  I would give more stars cause I like the food but the service needs to improve

GBc0MhNZiCAUkFTkJmJWPw.text: Be prepared for lines, a wait, and limited seating.   They get mucho -busy.  If you are a environmental evangelist, greenie, or sustainable.....you will panic when you see how the food is served..  Why?  All the food is served in styrofoam.  This becomes quite complicated when one tries to eat as the space is very limited and the containers consumer space.  I am picky about cleanliness and found that many of the other reviews were exaggerated.  Keep in mind, this place is a inexpensive fast food spot, it is not the Hotel Del Coronado.    Refried beans, in my mind, define a Mexican spot.  5 stars for their refried beans.    Tamales were great and fresh.  Tortillas are the size of a round man hole cover.  I had the mini chimis which were awesome and worth the $6.00.  I got robbed on my portion of the beans.  Still good.  :)  Ordered several items for the wife to try - all were a hit.  One does get nickel and dimed on tortilla chips.  As I have written before, anyone who spends $25 on fast Mexican food is entitled to as many chips and salsas as they want and they should not come at an additional cost.  If you try it, you will like it.  Just be mentally prepared for lines, styrofoam containers, and some dude complaining about the wait.  Chill that guy.

LRv8G1zn_MLUzM141Rckog.text: Here is the straight dope on Carolina's/Peoria:  If you are looking for super friendly service, keep looking. The service is inconsistent.  If you are looking for fast and competent, you will find it here most of the time.    If you are looking for a perfect order every time, keep walking.  If you take the time to thoroughly check your order, you will be satisfied, but you cannot be afraid to speak up. Sometimes they undercook the tacos which makes them seem stale.  The salsa is improved.  The chips are good. The beans and rice are yummy.   When it is super busy, you will not like most anything about it, but it is super busy because it is good food, so what do you want?  Also, they keep the AC on about 85 so be ready to sweat.   Now, the cleanliness issue.  There is an issue with cleanliness in the front of the house.  The back of the house seems to be kept much cleaner. For this reason, I get my food to go. I do NOT order beverages. The machines seem very unkempt and not maintained. I get the heeby jeebies just thinking about the bacteria in the ice maker and drink machines.    So that's my two cents.

FaL1kVS6LQD6oza8Yuzp_Q.text: No frills Mexican food. Nothing gourmet, nothing fancy, just tasty food at a good price. It's often crowded but if you're taking it home, phone in the order. You'll be in and out in minutes.   My only issue is that they are closed on Sundays.

HSCwqJec7ErIeafOdq_KCA.text: One of my favorite Mexican food spots! Yummy tortillas and red chili my son and daughters love the food also! If your in Peoria stop by and grab amazing food. I believe closed on Sunday's which says a lot about a restaurant.

u5nBDBkczW6PrZPYn80CrA.text: The family go-to when we have a big group to feed on a budget. This isn't really a dine-in place. The line snaking out the door is mostly take-out, but feel free to seat yourself after you get yout order and dine in.  They have meals with rice and beans or you can build your own. Don't go home without some fresh tortillas and guacamole.  The portions are generous and the food well prepared.   I wouldn't choose any other Mexican restaurant over Carolina's for any price.

U9KToi7JpQj8tJLVtlEasg.text: The one in Phoenix is way better I like the original better I go out of my  way to drive to south Phoenix

dT3BfKAqVkFqE8ytFBDIuw.text: Be aware this place will charge your card for a tip if you don't pay attention. My family and I having been coming to this restaurant for years and I have always had a good experience that I was aware of, however when I looked at my card transaction from Friday January 13th, 2017 I notice they charged my card for $19.55 and my bill was only $16.55. On this day the place was packed, the place was super dirty (I can understand since they where busy but still have someone quickly wipe stuff down), and the cashier I had was not polite nor was she paying attention. She was more concerned with the cashier next to her and talking to him. Please be careful when paying with a card here. I am sure since I don't usually check my card transactions here that I may have been wrongly charged before too. This place in my opinion has gone down over time and the food is still good but everything else seems to be lacking.

WYDfe-YoUD4kffyLXc6N1w.text: Great food for a small chain. Tortillas used for tacos are delicious. Highly recommended and not expensive.

ug1tWPa-ZCP6_oazUBHofg.text: Normally I would rate Carolinas much higher in stars except for today... I mean the food was good as usual, but the experience made me want scream...they let a patron with a DOG in a food establishment.... No no no... Not where I eat! I love dogs and love mine..but would never consider taking her in a restaurant.

duV5UfNNmN876ZzcFurzbw.text: As I read other reviews about this place, I've come to realized that I might have ordered the wrong items because I was disappointed with my entire meal! I'm from the mecca of Mexican food (Southern California), so I know what good Mexican food is about!!!  My husband and I decided to take a trip over Valentines weekend to Arizona to check out the Dodger's spring training in Glendale. I told him that we had to try out Arizona's version of Mexican food so he asked a local to recommend a great Mexican restaurant and they told us about this joint.  I got the two tamale plate with red sauce and my husband got the carne asada burrito along with chips and salsa. I didn't enjoy the tamales because it had a weird taste to it and the burrito was dry. The beans were actually the best part of the meal. The salsa could have been a little better, but the chips did seem fresh and crispy. Yeah, the places is a little run down and not "clean" as others say, but that type of stuff doesn't really bother me.

5pTa2Vc_KJJ4tz2uU6_sxg.text: First time visiting this place and I was not impressed.   It's dirty, a little disorganized (I understand that a restaurant will end up disorganized due to the chaos, but that does not excuse it from being dirty.)  The carne asada burritos were o.k. They don't have guacamole.  Their three way burrito is disgusting. It's meant to have green and red chili with beans, but I bit into the red chili side and didn't get to see if it had any green chili, because I stopped eating it.  Price is decent. Paid 16 dollars for 3 burritos, but for the type of food I got, I wouldn't pay 5 dollars for it. The quality is not great.   I wouldn't recommend it.

pa9DQjva9HhpkxiMAGFtPA.text: The food is really tasty but it's often hot in there and I've gotten sick the past two times I've been.  They have horchata which is amazing but the machine wasn't working the past two times I've been.

dFXmCmed7fZSPDF4tUskPg.text: Yummy stuff we get the green chili burrito and the shredded beef tacos. The hot sauce is also good. The food is 5 stats but these service is poor. It takes a long time to get your food. I would say 7 out of 10 this this has happened to us.

lczMtFpX9Ucty37jxU0yfQ.text: Terrible terrible service. I ordered a dozen tortillas, half pint hot sauce and one buttered tortilla. My tortillas and hot sauce were ready in less than ten minutes she said they're waiting for the buttered tortilla. I heard the girl ask about the tortilla and once again they asked cooks in kitchen. People ordering huge meals AFTER me we're getting their orders left and right while I stand there and wait for one single buttered tortilla. I finally got fed up and told the young man and other lady that it was ridiculous that I'm still waiting for the one single tortilla. It's ashamed I had to get pissy with them before they finally made a consorted effort to get it.  Really??  Poor organization and customer service.  Food is good, but I recommend you don't ever order one single buttered tortilla because you'll be waiting forever.

HvMKfhvOnAuIXU8wilakJQ.text: Only ever eaten here twice and the tacos were pretty good but I always pick up a pint of salsa for the family on my way home from work.  GET A PINT OF SALSAAAAAAA!!!! Goes good with chips, Mexican food, even a cold cut sandwich!

noCUgbGcZwjmT25fMFjNuQ.text: I like their food but it is getting to where I don't want to go. The inside of this place is disgustingly filthy!!! The garbage cans were running over, the area where the soda and salsa was was gross!! I tried so hard to not put any of my belongings down while I was waiting for my food. There was 3 registers but only 1 open and the line was growing. Not sure why the other 2 people behind the counter were doing food instead of having 1 do food and 1 do registers but hey, I am not the manager nor the owner. I will probably go back but not for a while and I hope they clean up!!

ek18aoIGSwGCZJX-m3XRpw.text: I would say that nothing stood out . The customer service was not great either. I thought that the food was basic and I was  not impressed by the experience. I will not go back to this place again.  Would you like feed back one how to improve. ... Get menu's for people who want to move  out if the way of crowds standing in line and decide on what they want to eat especially since I have never been there and also make your customers feel like they are not just another sale but appreciated with a thanks for your business or have a great day / night. Just a thought

PVgrCHmmzBJz6MIgRwPnpg.text: Carolina's is our go to spot when we want good Mexican food. They always have friendly people that greet you and take your order. The menu has a lot of options or you can go a la carte. We typically stick with the combos. You tend to get good portions and good deal. And they do catering which is nice if you have want to have a celebration. The only downside is there have been a few mistakes made on orders over the years. But the staff is quick to remedy the problem and in some cases have even given up free food. So far, I have not found another place that compares.

3TQ7TfgfQ0fV8Mh03ALNlw.text: This place is one of my favorite go tos. Totally worth the wait! Green cheese enchiladas are my favorite. Oaxaca special is bomb.com and their guac and chips are also fantastic. Grab extra salsa because you'll want more later.

BjpXnSjCxU-wtycY6KXpCw.text: I'm forced to give them a star or else they would get ZERO! They have the rudest people working behind the counter! They can't even get a simple order correct when I called once home and discovered my order was wrong the manager had the nerve to ask what do you want me to do?!? The place is filthy and the health department has been contacted as well this place no way can pass a health inspection.... would be shocked if this place remains around much longer!

Q0ENy7C8fIBWk3AQGSoowQ.text: This is the best and the cheapest Mexican food place in town!  If you do not believe me, try to find a place to sit.  Yep, I have to eat in my truck, on most occasions, because I can't even find a table.  Literally, try it...  Unless you have an addictive personality.

qo2VpLo8CyX7ggHY4UgzZA.text: I heard this was good authentic Mexican food so I thought I would try it.  The menu selection was very limited (good from a business perspective).  I ordered a burrito and rice; the chicken burrito did not have much flavor and the rice was bland.    I will not go back unfortunately.

P5j9yBf7ntaXJwAuL6q2yg.text: My wife and I ordered to go. I had a bean burrito deep fried enchilada style she got a red Chile burrito the same way as mine. Neither one of cared for the enchilada sauce at all. It ruined both of our meals. The only thing that we both really loved was the chips. Very disappointed might go back for just the chips and flower tortillas I will stick to PoPo's.

wSIT8ICNXFmxBI52Sq-f2w.text: It's ok , everybody raves of how great it is . They must not have really good Mexican food . If your not picky about your food or waiting 25 minutes to get it then this is your place.

yYQRRD7Sb89zd1IApfH6AQ.text: First and last time here. Ordered tamales red chile and beef or should I say a speck of chile and a nickle size amount of beef a dozen for $28.81 yes... that was disgustingly expensive. This place is not mexican and it is over priced  and flavorless, I'm  certain it is frozen microwaved food and the staff is very unfriendly and rude the place is dirty. Don't risk it if you love Mexican food it's not worth it a total embarrassment to Mexican food. Wish I can give them a speck of a star like they did to the beef.

wtmx2uB4mGU_hmzL5syb0Q.text: So few days ago was my third time giving Carolina's a try and I live very close to it... Wasn't impressed the first time.... Nor the second time... Unfortunately the third time I was done wasn't all that great expected to sink my teeth into a delicious breakfast burrito and I had huge pieces of boiled potato not even fried... Tasteless... Very disappointed

2OsgxWZQU-CHcpw3ibvn2w.text: Great mexican food, at a fair price and fast!  They are always helpful with their menu and patient as I look for something new to try.   I have never had a bad experience here.  We will be back!

TQISaKi5uzbzROpadHMFaw.text: Let me explain why this place deserves no more than 3 stars:  They shout customer orders over a loud speaker like you are getting a wake-up call via the 1MC on a US Navy ship.  No, that is not a good thing!  Plus, it is crowded, packed, and very loud.  People seem to come here for the cheap food ($5-6 per order), but you get what you pay for.  Carolina's West personnel throw bland food in a styrofoam carton and expect you to be content with some various combinations of lettuce, beans, cheese, and tortillas.  The taste is totally bland.  Abuelos, which is just a couple miles to the north, is a much better option for Mexican food.  Don't say that I didn't warn you!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carolina's Mexican Food Peoria - Peoria, AZ, United States. Enchilada, taco, and tostada...  #3 special

kFcS4y31Ufn78m6mSLRFSQ.text: Prepare to wait a long time!  The burritos are good but that's about it.  The rest is just mediocre.

bobdt_zdQcFBmxwZjcFGdQ.text: Carolina's is one of the best Mexican food places in the west valley. The wait is long, sure, but if you call ahead of time and take it to go the wait is minuscule.   I normally get the #9 which has two tacos with rice and beans. The flavor of the beans is amazing plus they are rich and creamy.   The price is super cheap. A family of 3-4 can eat here for $25 and under.   I would recommend staying away from eating inside the place because it is a bit hectic and not always clean-- given that they are busy.

yhIlLOGWeri2UlTDnD5Rww.text: Killer Mexican food. Always good and definitely not overly greasy. They make their own tortillas. The red choke burrito enchilada style is my favorite.

2qLiVNXGiL7uAgrwYouovQ.text: Not sure what people see! Hubby was supposed to have a chorizo burrito but couldn't find it with the massive potatoes in it. My chicken chimi was very bland! Guacamole had no flavor along with the tasteless rice. What Mexican food restaurant does give chips!!!! Won't be coming back!

Eaw7dNYYo2naovEt3Q8zCA.text: This location needs some serious attention. This is the 3rd time I have been here and it has gotten worse each time.  This time 25 minute wait for carne asada, diet Dr Pepper was flat, ice was out but they were in the process of refilling.  Just not the same as downtown.

VXFZUUy9qqjQ3tLs0zx3bg.text: This is my favorite Mexican food place.  They serve you fast.  I highly recommend the #15 special.  Ask for some spices on the side.  And don't forget to get a drink on the side because the have Mexican drink machine so if you're feeling adventurous you can get flavored horchatas and juices with free refills.  It sounds like I work there but it's just Cuz I eat there so often.  I absolutely love Carolinas!

xyek0mfztn9ws4eFaGkBNQ.text: If you don't know how authentic Mexican food should taste like and want something better than all the "Betos" then this is an edible place to grab something fast.

Ek9lq3sho_flVeaVUgIlnw.text: Such excellent service!  This location is currently training employees and I can honestly say we've received better service from those in training than we have the regular staff. Last night I went in to pick up a to-go order. The guy who helped me took the time to go through my order with me to confirm I had everything I ordered and that it was correct. Such a simple thing to do...but imagine if everyplace did this. It would save so much frustration!  Thank you Carolina's for training your employees right!

32U9s2wsRpKuaGlsJvFqaA.text: Customer service is horrible!!!! Screwed up a order last week, called it in to replace it. Come in today to get my replace order then I have to pay for it! And then the food I ordered today they screw up on!!! Cassandra and Jesus seemed to be the ones in charge of the whole operation here and definitely don't seem to know how to operate a business or ensure great customer service to the people. Definitely will go out of my way to make sure people don't come here.

MKJku5-xwzkXb34Ibi464Q.text: I guess I'm just spoiled from living in New Mexico my whole life (best mexican food EVER).  This place had been recommended to me by pretty much everyone when I told them I was looking for NM style Mexican food. We finally made it here & I was stoked! The girl behind the counter kept answering the phone while we were ordering, another worker was walking past us cursing at another employee...awwwwwkward. Now I'm willing to look past all of that IF the food is good, sadly disappointed doesn't even begin to cover it.    I ordered a carne asada chimichanga & my husband ordered the chorizo & potato combo plate.  The food came out quickly & my husband couldn't figure out what he was looking at on his plate.  It was just ground beef on top of mashed potatoes. Every place he's ever been has served it with fried potatoes & actual chorizo. Is this normal for AZ?  He didn't even want to eat it the food was so bland. I cut into my chimi & couldn't believe the meat that was coming out of it...boiled dry hamburger meat.  This was absolutely not carne asada. I gave it a shot thinking that at least if it's flavorful it won't matter. Nope. Bland, dry absolutely NO flavor. The guacamole on top was great & the tortilla wasn't heavy from being fried, it was nice & light.  But what's a chimi without yummy fillings?! I couldn't even finish it, we both had weird artificial aftertastes in our mouths as we were leaving. Blech. Sorry, but this is a huge "never again" for me.
